i18n.pages.docs.about.blog_posts.lack_of: Please note that this page is not localized, with the entries below being in the language of the article.
i18n.pages.docs.about.blog_posts.welcome: Welcome to the Scribe blog posts! Below you can find articles on Scribe's software from members of our community and from around the web. Feel free to add your own article to this page!
i18n.pages.docs.about.community.contribu: Thank you to all of our amazing
i18n.pages.docs.about.community.descript: The Scribe community includes language enthusiasts, open-source developers and individuals who are passionate about the potential of building applications around open-data. Below you can find the profiles of the members of our development community. Beyond those who write code, Scribe also welcomes designers who improve user interfaces and user experience as well as localization professionals who help us bring our software to people around the world.
i18n.pages.docs.about.community.localiza: Scribe has members from across the world, and many have localized our applications into their native language. We also have the pleasure of working with the Weblate localization community. You can find our localization project at
i18n.pages.docs.about.community.open_des: Scribe has benefitted immensely from the professional design support that has helped us create user friendly applications while adhering to strict accessibility standards. In particular Scribe would like to thank the Open Source Design community that has supported with many design tasks. You can learn more about Open Source Design at
i18n.pages.docs.about.index.blog_posts: Read articles from around the web written about Scribe projects and our community.
i18n.pages.docs.about.index.our_communit: Learn about the community that makes Scribe applications and how you can get involved.
i18n.pages.docs.about.index.support_scri: Learn about the many ways to support Scribe and its projects.
i18n.pages.docs.about.index.supporters: View an overview of the various organizations that support Scribe.
i18n.pages.docs.about.support_us.section: Scribe needs support from our community in countless ways. The following details how organizations and individuals can help the team develop open-source, open-data applications to empower language learners. A full list of Scribe's current supporters can be found on the following page:
Details of public funding for Scribe are forthcoming! Thank you for your support!
Please contact the team afterwards via our public Matrix space or email team[at]scri.be so that we're aware and can help spread the word!

Be it artistic contributions or your experience with language learning communities, we'd love to discuss how we could work together. We'd be happy to give credit in the Contributors section on the following page:

Scribe uses Weblate, an open-source, web-based localization platform, for all translations for our projects. Please visit the following project page to help us localize Scribe applications and this website:
i18n.pages.docs.about.supporters_showcas: The following is an overview of organizations and individuals that have supported the development of Scribe projects. Those interested in providing support can read more about how they can help on the following page:

Scribe projects have been proudly developed in the open from inception. Our projects would not be what they are without the support of our open-source community. Thank you to all our contributors on GitHub!
Scribe has received design support from many individuals.

The following organizations have supported Scribe through participation in Wikimedia movement events and programs. Specifically Scribe has been able to participate in internship programs such as Google Summer of Code and Outreachy, as well as Wikimedia hackathons and other developer outreach events. Thank you to the following organizations and the Wikimedia movement!
i18n.pages.docs.conjugate.index.conjugat: Read the changelog for the Scribe-Conjugate Android application
Read the changelog for the Scribe-Conjugate iOS application
Learn about the Scribe-Conjugate project that provides free, open-source and open-data verb conjugations.
i18n.pages.docs.conjugate.learn_more.ben: With a simple, intuitive interface, the app lets you search for any verb and see its full conjugation across tenses and moods. Whether you're writing, speaking, or studying, Scribe makes it easy to find the right form, understand patterns, and improve your language skills. Seamlessly integrated with the Scribe ecosystem, it works alongside our keyboards and data tools for a complete language experience.
i18n.pages.docs.conjugate.learn_more.fea: Comprehensive verb conjugations for many world languages.
Quick search and instant results for any verb form.
Clear, easy-to-read tables for all tenses and moods.
Helpful tips and explanations for irregular verbs and tricky forms.
Works together with Scribe keyboards and data tools for a unified language learning experience.
i18n.pages.docs.conjugate.learn_more.int: The Scribe Conjugation App is your personal assistant for mastering verb forms in multiple languages. Designed for language learners and multilingual users, it provides instant access to accurate verb conjugations, helping you communicate with confidence and precision.
i18n.pages.docs.data.index.data_changelo: Read the changelog for the Scribe-Data project
i18n.pages.docs.data.index.data_page_des: Learn about the Scribe-Data project that extracts language data from Wikidata and other sources.
i18n.pages.docs.data.learn_more.benefits: Our data covers a wide range of languages and is carefully curated for quality and reliability. Whether you're typing, learning, or exploring new languages, Scribe-Data works behind the scenes to deliver helpful suggestions, correct forms, and relevant information—making your Scribe experience smarter and more enjoyable.
i18n.pages.docs.data.learn_more.feature_: Comprehensive language coverage for many world languages.
Accurate and regularly updated linguistic information.
Supports keyboards, conjugation, and other Scribe features.
Data sourced from trusted, open repositories like Wikidata.
Enhances your experience with smart suggestions and reliable results.
i18n.pages.docs.data.learn_more.intro_pa: Scribe-Data is the heart of the Scribe ecosystem, providing the rich linguistic information that powers our keyboards, conjugation tools, and more. By gathering and organizing language data from trusted sources, Scribe-Data ensures that every feature you use is accurate, up-to-date, and tailored to your needs.
i18n.pages.docs.index.content_page_img_a: Navigate to the page to learn more.
i18n.pages.docs.index.docs_description: Learn about Scribe applications and our community.
i18n.pages.docs.keyboard_apps.index.keyb: Read the changelog for the Scribe Language Keyboards Android application
Read the changelog for the Scribe Language Keyboards iOS application
Learn about the Scribe Language Keyboards project that provides keyboards for second language learners.
i18n.pages.docs.keyboard_apps.learn_more: Easy language switching for multilingual users.
Built-in translation and verb conjugation tools.
Smart suggestions for correct spelling, grammar, and word choice.
Seamless integration with all your favorite apps and devices.
Support for a growing list of world languages, with more added regularly.

Scribe Language Keyboards are smart, user-friendly keyboards designed to make typing in different languages easy and enjoyable. Whether you're learning a new language or communicating with friends and colleagues around the world, Scribe keyboards help you express yourself accurately and confidently, right from your device.

With Scribe, you can seamlessly switch between languages, access helpful tools like translation and conjugation, and enjoy a typing experience tailored to your needs. Our keyboards are built to integrate smoothly with your favorite apps and devices, supporting a wide range of languages and offering features that make multilingual communication effortless.
i18n.pages.docs.legal._global.english_te: Please note that the English text of this document takes precedence over all other versions.
i18n.pages.docs.legal._global.privacy_po: A shield with a check in the middle of it to indicate that the user is safe using Scribe software.
i18n.pages.docs.legal.imprint.message: We look forward to hearing from you :)
i18n.pages.docs.legal.imprint.section_1_: Scribe is a community of language enthusiasts, learners and developers creating tools to help people communicate with confidence.
We are currently working on the legal entity behind Scribe. Further information will be available on this page once the arrangements are finalized. Thank you for your patience!
i18n.pages.docs.legal.index.privacy_poli: Read the privacy policy for this website.
i18n.pages.docs.legal.index.trademark_po: Read the trademark policy for Scribe.
i18n.pages.docs.legal.privacy_policy.sec: At Scribe, we value your privacy and are committed to maintaining the trust and confidence of our users. This Privacy Policy explains how we handle your information and the choices you have regarding your information.

By using Scribe projects, you agree to the provisions of this Privacy Policy. Our primary goal is to provide tools that allow users to confidently communicate in languages that they're learning. We have and will continue to implement various measures to ensure the privacy and security of our users. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact us at security[at]scri.be.

We encourage users to contribute to the Scribe projects and participate in discussions about privacy, security, and other important topics. By engaging with our community, you can help shape the future of Scribe and ensure that it remains a safe, inclusive, and empowering community for all.

Our website scri.be uses Plausible Analytics for non-identifiable tracking of the regions from which people visit. The website does not collect any personally identifiable information from our users at this time.

We use the anonymous location data we collect from Plausible Analytics to get a better idea of where there's interest Scribe applications. As we do not collect personal information at this time, we do not use any such information for any purpose.

We do not share your personal information with any third parties. Scribe is dedicated to ensuring the privacy of our users. The team has no plans to share data with parties outside of our organization.

We are committed to ensuring the security of our projects and the information of our users. In the event of a data breach, we will promptly notify affected users and take appropriate measures to address the situation.
We plan to implement various security measures to protect the integrity of our projects and the safety of our users. We also encourage users to practice good security habits.

As we do not collect personal information at this time, you do not need to worry about exercising any rights related to your personal data. However, if you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or our practices, please feel free to contact us at security[at]scri.be.

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. If we make significant changes, we will publicly update our community through communication channels and social media. By continuing to use Scribe projects after any changes are in effect, you agree to the updated Privacy Policy.
i18n.pages.docs.legal.trademark_policy.s: The Scribe name and logos are trademarks of scri.be, a soon to be incorporated organization. As such, their use is restricted and protected by intellectual property law. While the software we create is available under a free and open source software license, the copyright license does not include an implied right or license to use our trademarks.

The role of trademarks is to prevent the exploitation of the good name and reputation of scri.be by other people and organizations, and to provide assurance about the quality of the products and services associated with it.

To use our trademarks beyond what is considered "fair" or "nominative" use, you must follow these guidelines. By making use of our trademarks, you agree to abide by the following terms and conditions.
You agree to defend and indemnify scri.be from and against any and all claims and losses brought by a third party in connection with your use of the scri.be trademarks.
To request the use of the Scribe name and logos in a way not covered in these guidelines, or to report violations, please contact us at
In the event that we do not approve such use of the Scribe name and logos within fourteen (14) business days, your request shall be deemed denied.
Only use the Scribe marks to accurately identify those goods or services that are built by the scri.be organization.
Do not use the Scribe marks in any way that could mistakenly imply that scri.be has reviewed, approved, or guaranteed your goods or services.
Do not use or register, in whole or in part, the Scribe marks as part of your own or any other trademark, service mark, domain name, company name, trade name, product name, or service name.
Do not use the Scribe marks in a manner that disparages or defames the marks, scri.be, or other products associated with scri.be.
You may use the Scribe word mark in referential phrases such as "for", "as found on", etc.
You may use the Scribe marks when embedding or otherwise displaying user generated content published using the Scribe software.
Do not change or modify the Scribe marks in any way.
Any all use of the Scribe marks, and any goodwill accrued as a result of that use, belongs entirely to, and shall inure for the benefit of, scri.be.
General guidelines
You must choose your own branding, logos, and trademarks that denote your unique identity so as to clearly signal to users that there is no affiliation with or endorsement by scri.be.

You may use word marks, but not our logos, in truthful statements that describe the relationship between your software and ours, for example "this software is derived from the source code of scri.be projects".
If you choose to build on or modify Scribe's open-source code in a product meant for third parties, specifically outside code, design, translation and other contributions to the scri.be projects:
Open source project guidelines
In addition, Scribe logos cannot be used in a way that might suggest affiliation with or endorsement by Scribe, unless this has been agreed to in writing.
Social media guidelines

Please contact us if you have any questions, comments, or concerns about this Trademark Policy. We welcome feedback from our users and are always looking for ways to improve our projects to better serve our community.
Contact Us
i18n.pages.docs.server._global.clipboard: An icon of a clipboard with a bar chart representing data on it.
i18n.pages.docs.server.available_data.do: The currently available data can be downloaded as SQLite databases from the following URL
i18n.pages.docs.server.available_data.ta: The following table shows the data that's available to Scribe applications on Scribe-Server. This data is generated by Scribe-Data and then sent to the applications to assure that they have up to date data in a process that's independent from updating the app.
i18n.pages.docs.server.index.available_d: View an overview of the data that's available to Scribe applications
i18n.pages.docs.server.index.server_chan: Read the changelog for the Scribe-Server project
i18n.pages.docs.server.index.server_page: Learn about the Scribe-Server project that provides data to our applications.
i18n.pages.docs.server.learn_more.benefi: With Scribe-Server, you benefit from fast performance, automatic updates, and synchronized access to language services across all your devices. The server infrastructure works quietly in the background, so you can focus on learning, communicating, and exploring languages—knowing that Scribe is always ready to help.
i18n.pages.docs.server.learn_more.featur: Reliable access to language tools and resources, anytime and anywhere.
Automatic updates to keep your features and data current.
Fast, responsive performance for a smooth user experience.
Secure and private connection for your language activities.
Seamless integration with all Scribe apps and services.
i18n.pages.docs.server.learn_more.intro_: Scribe-Server is the backbone of the Scribe ecosystem, ensuring that all your language tools and resources are always available when you need them. By connecting your devices to a secure and reliable server, Scribe-Server delivers up-to-date features, data, and support for a seamless user experience. Scribe-Server is hosted on Toolforge and uses MariaDB to manage and deliver language data efficiently.
i18n.pages.docs.server.learn_more.page_h: Scribe-Server: Reliable Language Services for Everyone
i18n.pages.index.conjugate_aria_label: Learn more about the Scribe conjugation applications
i18n.pages.index.conjugate_text: We're developing advanced verb conjugation applications based on open data. Get all verb conjugations found in Wikidata in a streamlined UI that lets you search for verbs in multiple languages at the same time. All this without ads or your data going to third parties.
i18n.pages.index.contributors_text: Thanks to all of our community developers for making Scribe applications a reality!
i18n.pages.index.data_aria_label: Learn more about the Scribe-Data project
i18n.pages.index.data_text: Our Wikidata language data processes are open for all to use. Leverage Scribe-Data to get language packs of all data from the Wikidata Query Service or Wikidata dumps in a convenient Python command line interface.
i18n.pages.index.language_keyboards_aria: Learn more about the Scribe language keyboard applications
i18n.pages.index.language_keyboards_text: Our flagship application is Scribe Language Keyboards — mobile keyboards that are tailored to help language learners communicate in their second language. Scribe keyboards can be used in any app and help users with translation, verb conjugation, noun genders and much more!
i18n.pages.index.our_supporters_text: Help us create and maintain our open-source language learning software. Please consider contributing your skills, reach or money.
i18n.pages.index.scribe_community_img_al: A globe graphic with icons representing development, design, translation, communication and teamwork.
i18n.pages.index.scribe_section_btn_aria: Learn more about the Scribe community
i18n.pages.index.scribe_section_text: We're a global community of language enthusiasts, learners and developers creating tools to help people communicate with confidence. An official Wikimedia project for new developers, we strive to create an inclusive environment in all aspects of our work.
i18n.pages.index.server_aria_label: Learn more about the Scribe-Server project
i18n.pages.index.server_text: You can also make calls to the Scribe-Server API that our client applications use to get language data updates. Get structured data on demand via a fast and reliable service.
i18n.pages.index.title: Welcome
